text: now it's emerged tonight that the Prime
Minister's chief adviser Dominic

did he break the lockdown well Clive it

down with corona virus symptoms Downing
Street said at the time that he was self
isolating at home but tonight the
Guardian and the mirror newspapers are
reporting that subsequently he in fact
travelled to his parents home in Durham
and that police made contact with the
family to remind them of the rules
around essential travel now the guidance
at the time that was made law just a few
days before so there were only a limited
number of reasons why people should be
leaving their homes and if you have
corona virus symptoms yourself the
guidance was and is that you shouldn't
be leaving your homes at all for at
least 7 days now a source close to
Dominic Cummings has confirmed that he
did travel from London to Durham when he
had coronavirus but says he wasn't
spoken to by police the source says he
and his wife stayed in a separate
building and the reason they traveled
there was because they were both ill and
needed help with child care now remember
there have been other senior figures
who've been accused of breaking lockdown
rules
Scotland's former chief medical officer
